thread.title: Flight attendant nails Britney's 'Toxic' video with onboard dance number
thread.title_full: Flight attendant nails Britney's 'Toxic' video with onboard dance number

author: Yvette Tan
title: Flight attendant nails Britney's 'Toxic' video with onboard dance number
text:
Talk about giving Britney Spears a run for her money.
Assraf Nasir, a flight attendant on Malaysian carrier AirAsia, mimicked Britney's iconic mile-high "Toxic" music video ‚Äî and absolutely nailed it.
SEE ALSO: That Britney Spears biopic is a travesty, and Twitter wants its 2 hours back
Nasir is seen in a Tweeted video strutting down and up the aisle of a Airbus A330, singing into the intercom and even pushing a food trolley in true Britney style.
A Toxic performance on A330 by @AssrafNasir . Cc @britneyspears üíÉüèºüíÉüèº pic.twitter.com/xoRksL1DZw
‚Äî huski üåô (@FarhanRzman) March 16, 2017
Here's the original for comparison:
The video, which was originally uploaded by Nasir's co-worker Farhan Rzman , has since gone viral and has been viewed almost 9 million times after it was posted by 9GAG .
"Booking my flights on AirAsia now," said one Facebook user.
Image: twitter/ assraf nasir
"When people ask me why I want to be a flight attendant I'm showing them this," said another netizen.
"Is this why my flight was delayed for 'cleaning and inspection'?" one asked.
And it's not only netizens who were impressed.
Nasir's boss, the CEO of AirAsia, reposted the video on Instagram saying that he loved "that staff can just have fun."
Classic. Airasia version of Toxic. The talent in Airasia never fails to amaze me. @assrafnasir is the best. Love it that staff can just have fun and be themselves.
A post shared by Tony Fernandes (@tonyfernandes) on Mar 16, 2017 at 6:43am PDT
And if you still can't get enough of Nassir:
Tak sama set crew. Kalau sama, that's it. Habis terbalik kapal. üòÇ
A post shared by Assraf Nasir (@assrafnasir) on Mar 1, 2017 at 9:07pm PST
We all know which airline we're taking next time.
